an5.215:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of intolerance.
an5.215:4.3: Most people find you unlikable and disagreeable. You have lots of enmity and many flaws. You feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an5.215:4.4: These are the five drawbacks to intolerance.
an5.215:5.1: There are these five benefits of tolerance.
an5.215:5.3: Most people find you likable and agreeable. You have little enmity and few flaws. You don’t feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.215:5.4: These are the five benefits of tolerance.”
